name: Beware, The Ides of Swifty Quiz | Word Play | 10 Questions

questions.text:
EXAMPLE: "I like camping," said Tom ___.  The answer is INTENTLY. 

Note: The spellings are always correct English, although the pronunciation may not be. The hint will tell the number of words and letters.  Also the beginning and last letters IE: S/LY or S/D.  There are no periods after any of the answers..

QUESTION ONE:  "Dorothy, if you're going to Oz again, I'm going with you", Auntie ___.
questions.explanation:
Em Barked&embarked.

	Dorothy's Aunt in 'The Wizard of Oz' was Aunt Em.

questions.text: "This is the most common language used on micros", said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Basically.

	Basic is a computer programming language.

questions.text: "These bit patterns will be more readable in groups of 8", said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Bitingly.

	Eight bits is a byte.

questions.text: "My ancestor was a famous Confederate general who had an army fort named after him", Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Bragged.

	General Braxton Bragg has two forts named after him, one in North Carolina and one in California.

questions.text: "That young insect is male", said Tom ___.
"My wife is cheating on me", Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Cackled.

	If your wife is cheating on you, you are said to be a cuckold.

questions.text: "Rowing so much hurts my hands", said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Callously.

	Rowing a lot causes callouses.

questions.text: "One can't dispute the fundamental importance of learning the alphabet", ___.
questions.explanation:
Abie Ceded.

	Abie Ceded...A B C D.  The spelling Abie is not as in Abbie or Abbey.  It is a nickname for Abraham...as in Abe-ie.

questions.text: "I'm afraid you've had a stroke", said Tom ___.
questions.explanation:
Cerebrally.

	A stroke is a brain 'malfunction'.
